hint.text: Volume of cylinder = Pi x radius\(^2\) x height

solution.text:
Since Volume is constant, the square of radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
Pi \(\times\) Radius\(^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \( r^2 \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
Therefore, taking case 1, \(_{{10*k}}_^2 \times _{{40*j}}_ \)= K
Hence, K= _{{4000*j*k*k}}_
If Height= _{{10*j}}_ cm
Radius\(^2 = \frac{K}{height}\)
Radius\(^2 = \frac{_{{4000*j*k*k}}_}{_{{10*j}}_}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = _{{20*k}}_ cm

content.text: The volume of a right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is _{{40*j}}_ and Radius is _{{10*k}}_ cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is _{{10*j}}_ cm.
